puff.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to breathe quickly and with difficulty after the effort of running, carrying something heavy etc
puff.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: George puffed and panted as he tried to keep up.
He caught up with Gary, puffing for breath.
An old man puffed up to them.
puff.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to breathe in and out while smoking a cigarette or pipe
puff.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Kinane sat in silence, puffing thoughtfully at his pipe.
puff.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: if smoke, steam etc puffs from somewhere, or if something puffs it, it comes out in little clouds
puff.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Steam puffed out of the chimney.
The boiler was puffing thick black smoke.
Don’t puff smoke into my face.
puff.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: to move in a particular direction, sending out little clouds of steam or smoke
puff.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: The train puffed steadily across the bridge.
puff.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: the action of taking the smoke from a cigarette, pipe etc into your lungs
puff.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: He laughed and took a puff on his cigar.
puff.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: a sudden small movement of wind, air, or smoke
puff.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: The dragon disappeared in a puff of smoke.
puff.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: I was out of puff (=had difficulty breathing).
puff.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: a piece of writing or a speech that praises someone too much – used to show disapproval
puff.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: an advertisement or other piece of writing in a newspaper etc that strongly praises a product
